thread.title: St. James wins third straight volleyball regional
thread.title_full: St. James wins third straight volleyball regional

title: St. James wins third straight volleyball regional
text:
St. James wins third straight volleyball regional Ethan Bernal , Montgomery Advertiser 12 a.m. CDT October 25, 2015 Buy Photo St. James' Clayton Waring (8) during their game with Trintiy in the Montgomery Area volleyball tournament at Trinity Presbyterian School on Tuesday, Oct. 21, 2014. (Photo: Lloyd Gallman/Advertiser) Buy Photo 2 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
This is nothing new for St. James. 
The Trojans volleyball squad handled business as usual, winning their third straight Class 4A South Regional Tournament at Cramton Bowl on Saturday. 
St. James defeated Trinity in three sets in the finals, marking the fourth time the area rivals have faced off this season. 
It wasn’t new for many of the Trojans players, but it was new to Trojans coach Karen Lee. 
An assistant the past four years, Lee took over as head coach this season. 
“This is my first win as a head coach. For several of them, it’s their third time winning this, so I’m so proud and so happy for them,” Lee said. 
Coming off of a five-set victory over the Wildcats in the area tournament earlier in the week, the Trojans swept Trinity 25-14, 25-14, 25-9 in the finals. 
Led by outside hitter Clayton Waring, the lone senior, St. James went through the tournament without dropping a set. 
“She’s been great. Especially in this game, you could see how she really wanted it. She knew that this was in her last leg of her volleyball career,” Lee said. “You could tell it on her face, you could tell it in her actions, she wanted this one badly.” 
The Trojans (30-8) defeated Andalusia 25-11, 25-13, 25-13 in the quarterfinals, and Satsuma 25-14, 25-22, 25-17 in the semifinals. 
“It feels good. This is our third one in a row. We’ve been working so hard, and we just decided that we were going to give it our all and put it all out there,” Waring said. “It’s definitely more emotional, realizing this is my last time doing all this. It’s been my life for so long, it’s just really emotional.” 
The Wildcats (23-16) beat Straughn 25-18, 25-13, 25-18 in the quarterfinals and edged out UMS-Wright 28-16, 26-24, 20-25, 16-25, 17-15. 
St. James and Trinity qualified for the Class 4A state tournament Wednesday and Thursday at the Birmingham CrossPlex. UMS-Wright and Satsuma also qualified. 
Even though St. James has just one senior, Lee is confident in her veteran group of seven juniors heading into the state tournament. 
“I feel great going into state, knowing that they’ve been there before. They’ve been through it, so they kind of know what to expect,” Lee said. 
Ethan Bernal , who covers high school athletics for the Advertiser, can be reached by emailing him at ebernal@gannett.com or follow him on Twitter @EthanGBernal. 2 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://on.mgmadv.com/1S3HMY3 TOP VIDEOS
